title: How to ensure the PPWR actually enables more sustainable packaging - EURACTIV
summary: The article discusses the importance of sustainable packaging and advocates for measures supporting innovation and sustainability in the beverage carton industry within the context of the Packaging and Packaging Waste Regulation (PPWR) in the EU.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article focuses on promoting sustainability and innovation in the packaging industry to achieve environmental goals, such as circularity and lower emissions.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not primarily focus on a new or significantly improved business process or product but emphasizes sustainability in packaging.
green_product: TRUE. The article highlights the benefits of beverage cartons as a sustainable packaging solution that aims to reduce environmental impact throughout its lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article advocates for green processes in packaging production, emphasizing the importance of minimizing environmental impacts, reducing waste, and promoting circularity.
company: The Alliance for Beverage Cartons and the Environment (ACE)
official_company_name: The Alliance for Beverage Cartons and the Environment (ACE)
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 322130 - Paperboard Container Manufacturing, 562910 - Remediation Services, 424920 - Book, Periodical, and Newspaper Merchant Wholesalers, 493190 - Other Warehousing and Storage
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it promotes transparent sustainability practices and advocates for eco-friendly packaging solutions.

title: Recycling of Polyurethane Foam Takes a Step Forward - AZoCleantech
summary: Researchers have developed a method to recycle polyurethane foam into new mattresses by breaking down the foam into its components, reusing the major component polyol in new products. The process is cost-effective and can be repeated multiple times, reducing landfill waste and moving towards a circular economy for flexible PU foam.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is a green innovation as it addresses environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste, promoting recycling, and moving towards a circular economy for flexible PU foam.
business_innovation: FALSE - While the process itself is innovative, it does not directly relate to a new or improved product or business process being introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE - The method of recycling polyurethane foam to create new mattresses aligns with the definition of a green product by significantly reducing environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The process of recycling polyurethane foam into new mattresses minimizes environmental impacts, promotes sustainability, reduces waste, and conserves natural resources.
company: Plixxent A/S, Dan-Foam Aps, Danish Technological Institute
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 326150 - Urethane and Other Foam Product (except Polystyrene) Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 541711 - Research and Development in Biotechnology
greenwashing: FALSE - The article describes a genuine effort to recycle polyurethane foam and reduce waste, rather than making deceptive claims about environmental benefits.

title: Old Mattresses Made New: Simple Chemistry Can Recycle Polyurethane - Technology Networks
summary: Researchers have developed a method to break down polyurethane foam into its main components for recycling. This process allows for the reuse of extracted polyol in new products, reducing waste and promoting a circular economy for flexible PU foam.
green_innovation: TRUE. This innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals by promoting recycling and reducing waste, aligning with principles of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE. While the innovation focuses on product recycling and waste reduction, it does not relate to the introduction of a new or significantly improved product or business process in the market.
green_product: TRUE. The innovation involves the development of a process that significantly reduces the environmental impact of polyurethane foam products by enabling recycling and reuse of materials, making it a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The method developed for breaking down polyurethane foam into recyclable components aligns with the definition of a green process by minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
company: Plixxent A/S, Dan-Foam Aps, Danish Technological Institute
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 561720 - Janitorial Services, 325222 - Noncellulosic Organic Fiber Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article describes a genuine innovation in polyurethane foam recycling that reduces waste and promotes a circular economy, without making false or misleading environmental claims.

title: Lush taps into the Barbie craze with a limited-edition collection - Premium beauty
summary: The Barbie x Lush collection features personal and beauty care products in Barbie's signature pink color. The collection includes 'naked' products that require no packaging and a closed-loop recycling program for products in packaging.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 446120 Cosmetic, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores, 812112 Beauty Salons, 454111 Electronic Shopping and Mail-Order Houses
